description: Use the Microsoft Edge Tools from within VS Code to see your site's runtime HTML structure, alter its layout, fix styling issues as well as see your site's network requests.
displayName: Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code
commands.0.title: Attach to a target
commands.1.title: Launch Edge and then attach to a target

configuration.title: Microsoft Edge Tools
configuration.properties.vscode-edge-dev: The hostname on which to search for remote debuggable instances
The port on which to search for remote debuggable instances
Should we request the remote target list using https rather than http
The default url to open when launching the browser without a target
The default entrypoint into your webpage. Used to resolve debugging urls without a pathname
By default, Microsoft Edge is launched with a separate user profile in a temp folder. Use this option to override the path. You can also set to false to launch with your default user profile instead.
The absolute path to the webserver root. Used to resolve paths like `/app.js` to files on disk
A set of mappings for rewriting the locations of source files from what the sourcemap says, to their locations on disk
A set of mappings to override the locations of source map files.
Use JavaScript source maps (if they exist)
Show service and shared workers in the target list.
Launch Microsoft Edge in headless mode. (requires relaunching Visual Studio Code)
Launch Microsoft Edge with specified args. (requires relaunching Visual Studio Code)
The number of milliseconds that the Microsoft Edge Tools will keep trying to attach the browser before timing out
Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will try to open the Microsoft Edge flavors in the following order: Stable, Beta, Dev and Canary
Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Stable version
Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Beta version
Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Dev version
Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Canary version
Enable feedback from webhint on source files to improve accessibility, compatibility, security and more.
Turn off notification for webhint installation failures.

submenus.0.label: Open with Edge
viewsContainers.activitybar.0.title: Microsoft Edge Tools
views.vscode-edge-devtools-view.0.name: Targets
views.vscode-edge-devtools-view.1.name: Helpful links
viewsWelcome.0.contents:
Launch an instance of Microsoft Edge to begin inspecting and modifying webpages.
[Launch Instance](command:vscode-edge-devtools-view.launch?[true])
viewsWelcome.1.contents:
To customize your launch experience, open a folder and create a launch.json file. 
[Open Folder](command:vscode.openFolder)
viewsWelcome.2.contents:
Customize your launch experience by adding a launch.json file to your project.
[Generate launch.json](command:vscode-edge-devtools-view.configureLaunchJson)
viewsWelcome.3.contents:
Customize your launch experience by adding a debug configuration to your launch.json file.
[Configure launch.json](command:vscode-edge-devtools-view.configureLaunchJson)
viewsWelcome.4.contents:
Launch an instance of Microsoft Edge to begin inspecting and modifying your site.
[Launch Project](command:vscode-edge-devtools-view.launchProject)
